intro: Phaca triphylla, commonly known as the three-leaved phaca, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas. Its leaves are trifoliate, meaning they are divided into three distinct leaflets, and the flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a compact cluster. Phaca triphylla is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
